intro: Pentacalia retroflexa, commonly known as the redstem pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and prairies. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a perennial herb that thrives in partial shade to full sun conditions.
